alert.note: Alert for Marion; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 8:25PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN WALKER...EASTERN MARION AND WINSTON COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CST... At 824 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Haleyville to Lake Buttahatchee to Brilliant. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Winfield, Haleyville, Carbon Hill, Lynn, Arley, Double Springs, Brilliant, Addison, Glen Allen, Kansas, Nauvoo, Eldridge, Curry, Houston Recreational Area, Camp McDowell, Smith Dam, Nesmith, Ashbank, and Brushy Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
